hypothesis: Discriminative features should be more transient (short-lived) than non-discriminative features

discriminative_features.description: Top-k features that drive classification decisions

non_discriminative_features.description: Other features with lower attribution scores

interpretation.conclusion: INCONCLUSIVE: No significant difference in temporal characteristics between discriminative and non-discriminative features. p-value: N/A

implication_for_overlapping_windows.if_discriminative_more_transient: Overlapping windows smooth transient features, destroying discriminative power
implication_for_overlapping_windows.if_discriminative_more_persistent: Overlapping windows should help, but experiments show degradation - other factors involved
